Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Inherently \In*her"ent*ly\, adv. By inherence; inseparably. [1913 Webster]
Matter hath inherently and essentially such an internal energy. --Bentley. [1913 Webster]
inherently adv : in an inherent manner; "the subject matter is sexual activity of any overt kind, which is depicted as inherently desirable and exciting"
